title: Designing Remote Project-Based Elementary Language Education: Strengthening Text Analysis, Writing, and Communication Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary-level understanding of basic grammar, acquisition of job-related basic vocabulary, and experience using digital tools
context.additional_context: Asynchronous activity design considering time constraints of working learners, with enhanced smartphone accessibility. Flexible learning environment configuration accounting for policy (privacy), technical (platform compatibility), and physical (internet access) constraints.

learning_goals: Learners enhance language application skills (document writing, communication, negotiation) in real workplace contexts by participating ≥2 times weekly in project-based learning (PBL) via smartphone collaboration tools (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet).

Learners accurately utilize ≥3 target language structures (grammar patterns, specialized vocabulary, formal expressions) weekly through formative assessments (quizzes, peer feedback, self-assessment).

Learners integrate ≥3 language skills (official document writing, business communication, negotiation strategies) reflecting real job scenarios (e.g., public institution reports, customer service scripts) in a 6-week PBL task, achieving grades of "B" (80–89 points) or higher in ≥4 of 5 rubric items (grammar accuracy, vocabulary diversity, contextual appropriateness, creativity, collaboration).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
